NoticeData.Contents: World 9 Update – Part 1 - Stages 401–430 of World 9: Vanaheim have been added. - You can obtain crafting recipes for Normal Mythical-grade equipment from stages 401–405. - Recipes for Fire and Water Mythical-grade equipment can be obtained from stages 415–427. - The crafting system for Mythical-grade equipment now includes the following characteristics: - Golden Dust is required as a material for crafting. - Some materials cannot be substituted with crystals and must be obtained directly through stages. - The Normal Mythical equipment has a lower level requirement of 350, to help existing players transition into World 9 more smoothly. - The remaining stages of World 9 and the final set of equipment will be released in the next update. - Stage dialogues that reveal the story of World 9 will also be available in the next update. 4 New Mythical-grade Auras Added - The following four Mythical-grade auras have been added to aura summons: YMIR, BEAST, AEGIS, and BARRAGE. - Summon rates have been adjusted with the addition of these Mythical-grade auras. 1 New Mythical-grade Costume & 2 New Sacred-grade Costumes - The Mythical-grade "Sea Ran" costume and 2 Sacred-grade costumes have been added to costume summons. - Summon rates have been adjusted with the addition of the Mythical-grade costume. - Sacred-grade costumes have received stat buffs following the introduction of the new Mythical grade. Rune Enhancement Cost Adjustment - To reduce the burden of enhancing certain runes, frequent NCG requirements have been compressed into 50-level intervals, and the required number of rune shards has been increased. - The following runes are included in this adjustment: - Golden Leaf Rune, Fenrir HP Rune, Fenrir ATK Rune, Fenrir Bleeding Rune, Saehrimnir HIT Rune, Saehrimnir DEF Rune, Saehrimnir Skill Rune, Stun Rune (Adventure), Stun Rune (Arena), Vampiric Rune (Adventure), Vampiric Rune (World Boss), Stamina Rune (Adventure), Stamina Rune (Arena), Quick Rune (Arena), Quick Rune (World Boss) Skill Balance Changes - The max damage of the Thorns skill attached to some Legend armor and world boss runes has been adjusted. - The damage dealt by these items and runes is now capped at 200,000 per hit. Leaderboard Feature Resumed - The leaderboard feature has been resumed for two categories in the client: Ability and World.

Arena Rule Changes - Ticket Refill Count: - Each refill (initial and subsequent) grants 5 tickets. - There are 20 ticket distributions per season, allowing a total of 100 basic tickets. - Additional ticket purchases limited to 24 tickets (4 per interval). - Purchase Prices: - Season: Starts at 1, increases by 0.2 per purchase. - Championship: Starts at 2, increases by 0.2 per purchase. - Up to 4 tickets can be purchased at once; unused tickets reset when the interval changes. - Service Stability Note: - During the last 10 blocks of each interval, refreshing the opponent list and conducting arena battles using tickets will be unavailable. - Additionally, ticket purchases will be unavailable during the last 40 blocks. - Score and Ranking Updates: - Updates occur at the start of each ticket refill interval. - Battle scores and win/loss stats are displayed in the UI and reset at the beginning of the next interval. - Opponent List Updates: - At each ticket refill interval, 5 fixed opponents are displayed based on rank groups: | Group | Range (%) | Win Score | Loss Score | | --- | --- | --- | --- | | 1st | Top 0–5% | +22 | -1 | | 2nd | Top 5–20% | +21 | -2 | | 3rd | Top 20–60% | +20 | -3 | | 4th | Top 60–80% | +18 | -4 | | 5th | Top 80–100% | +16 | -5 | - Opponents are chosen randomly from these groups. - If you are targeted and defeated by an opponent during the interval, your rating will decrease by 1. - Opponent refresh: - Up to 7 refreshes per round. - Refresh Cost - First 3 refreshes are free; the following 4 are paid. - The paid refresh cost starts at 0.5 NCG and increases by 0.5 NCG with each use. - Battles cost 5 AP per action. - Ingredients previously awarded as Arena rewards are now obtainable from specific stages in each world. Battle and Score Processing Updates - Opponent List & Scoring: - Now processed through dedicated external services rather than on-chain contracts. - Event Management: - Event organizers (other than Planetarium) can customize rules such as scoring and ranking. - On-Chain Records: - The blockchain will log and return battle results processed via external services. Clan Battle Feature - Clan Scoring: - Clan scores are calculated by summing the top 10 players’ scores within the clan. - Rewards: - Clan rankings determine seasonal rewards. - Testing Phase: - Clan data will first be tested on Thor. After testing, clan-related features will be rolled out across all chains. Game Improvements Planned Features - Inventory Sorting in the PC Version Shop: - Items are now grouped by type and sorted by CP (Combat Power). - Mobile Version - Planet Access Notification: - If planet data cannot be retrieved, a message will inform users that access is temporarily restricted and to try again later. - NCG Refund Button Adjustment in Staking Popup: - The NCG refund claim button, previously available only in the amount change flow, is now directly visible in the main popup. Bug Fixes - Resolved an issue where adding a new synthesis material removed previously registered materials.

NCG Claim Feature Addition and Stake Amount Adjustment Process Update - NCG Claim Distribution: - NCG used across each chain will now be distributed to staking users at a fixed percentage every block. - The total distributed amount will be divided proportionally based on the total staked NCG amount. - Once the accumulated amount exceeds a certain threshold, users will be able to claim their rewards. - Stake Adjustment Policy Update: - The previous 4-week lockup period required to decrease staked amounts has been removed. - However, if the staked NCG amount is reduced, the excess amount will only be refunded after 75,600 blocks (approximately one week) from the adjustment block. - While the reduced NCG is being processed for return, additional reduction requests cannot be made. - This adjustment is part of the Proof-of-Stake (PoS) policy, and further detailed explanations will be provided in upcoming announcements. --- Costume Summoning and Synthesis Features Added - In response to the overall enhancement of equipment and rune balance, the stats of all previously distributed costumes have been adjusted upward. - Additionally, a summoning feature has been added for 22 of the newly adjusted costumes, allowing players to acquire them through summons. - Costumes obtained via summoning can also be acquired through synthesis. --- Game Improvement - Patrol reward stabilization - Improvement of event dungeon ticket and AP point overlap issue - Added feature to prioritize sellable items in the PC shop 'Sell' section - Added planet name to push notifications in the mobile client - Improved mobile client to display only accessible planets when some planets are unavailable
